snippet: Organizers in New York City are working to bring together workers who, though their jobs are different, share the challenge of living on modest wages.
abstract: Labor organizers in New York City are planning to bring together low-paid workers representing different unions in a march from Herald Square to Union Square; intention is to lay the foundation for an aggressive lobbying campaign to highlight concerns about low wages, a widening income gap and the overall workplace struggles faced by many New Yorkers.
lead_paragraph: Organizers in New York City are working to bring together workers who, though their jobs are different, share the challenge of living on modest wages.

headline.seo: Planning a March, and Envisioning a Movement, to Unite Low-Wage Workers
headline.main: Planning a March, and Envisioning a Movement, to Unite Low-Wage Workers
headline.print_headline: Planning a March, and Envisioning a Movement, to Unite Low-Wage Workers
